result.execSummary:
The defendant George Edward Malone III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CORRECTED 10-21-2019 to give defendant CFTS he is entitled to.

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. All costs payable with bond on deposit.

Must not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling and/or assessments deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA and follow through. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. No contact with any known drug dealers or users. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. George Edward Malone III

records.addlTxt: Discharge - regular
DOC-Notice of Case Status change - revoked - sentenced to prison.
CFTS = 4 days
All records scanned

Defendant George Edward Malone in court with attorney Brian P Dimmer.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
The State files amended information in 16CF118.
In 15CF1344, pl to charge w/o repeater; the State recommends 18 mos IC/2 yrs ES,  In 16CF118 Cts 1 & 3 (w/o enhancer), balance are DRI; 17CF169 Ct 7 w/o repeater. Balance of counts are dismissed outright
P-NC to all
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

Both parties agree to waive PSI

BTC: guilty as above.   ****TAKEN INTO CUSTODY****

            15CF1344, Ct 1 - Total sentence is 3 1/2 yrs WPS bifurcated 18 mos IC, 2 yrs ES/CFTS

            16CF118, Ct 1 & 3 - Total sentence is 3 1/2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 18 mo IC, 2 yrs ES, conc with each other and 15CF1344/CFTS

            17CF169, Ct 7 - Total sentence is 3 1/2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 18 mos IC, 2 yrs ES, conc with 15CF1344 and 16CF118/CFTS

Bond to be applied to these files/costs. The balance is to be returned to the poster

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
costs
DNA sample & costs
no alc/cs  - UA's
any counseling/assessments deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA & ft
FT emp
no contact with any known drug users or dealers

FAW/vote

IS eligible for CIP and SAP
Plea hearing on September 21, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant George Edward Malone in court with attorney Brian P Dimmer.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
Defense indicates they received a global offer and asks for COP

BTC: Deft to report to RCAP today  Plea hearing scheduled for September 21, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant George Edward Malone in court with attorney Brian P Dimmer.  Lillian V. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
Matter set on for bond review by the Courts own motion based on a violation report filed by RCAP today. The State indicates that Ms. Lewis is not certain what Ms. Rich would like done regarding the bond and does not feel it appropriate to ask for bond to be modified. The State takes no position. Defense puts argument/explanation on the record.

BTC: Bond to be modified in 16CF118 - $2500.00 cash, $1,500.00 is already posted. Defendant has until Wednesday, June 27, 2018 at 4:00 pm to post additional $1,000.00 bond. If not, defendant is to report to RCJ.

Bail/bond hearing on June 22, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant George Edward Malone in court with attorney Brian P Dimmer.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
When Mr. Nunn was here last, bond modified to remove GPS/house arrest. Deft is being monitored by his agent. 
Regarding Mr. Malone, defense is still speaking to the State regarding a potential resolution.
Mr. Nunn is to be set for COP/SEH and Mr. Malone is going to be STC and do not need to be set together.
The Court will address deft's RCAP violations; defendant leaving his bracelet "dead"; deft not charging the bracelet as required. Defendant also owes $1,200.00 to RCAP
Deft indicates he has $300.00 to pay to RCAP today. The State asks that if deft has to work third shift, he needs to report those hours to RCAP based on the new referral Ms. Rich as received and the many 

BTC: Deft to report to RCAP today, pay them $300.00 and make arrangements to pay the balance. The deft is to discuss charging his bracelet with RCAP today.
                  bond to be modified to put deft on house arrest from 11:00 pm to 6:00 am unless working and deft must provide RCAP with a written schedule showing he is working during those periods.
            RCAP may ask for whatever proof they require to ensure deft is working during those hours.
  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant George Edward Malone in court with attorney Brian P Dimmer.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
There was a FB search so there is a lot of information found as well as a cell phone search that was conducted that needs to be provided to all defense attorneys.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant George Edward Malone in court with attorney Brian P Dimmer.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
Deft was ill at the last court date and did not come into the Courtroom. The State just gave defense some of the information he requested regarding possible other acts and there is another interview that Ms. Rich didn't realize existed and that she didn't have it. This matter is waiting for one of the Ellison's to go to trial. Defense is asking for further time in this matter. Defense asks for a bond modification without bond motion being filed. Defense is asking that house arrest be removed from the condition of GPS. The State does not object

BTC: Bonds may be modified to remove house arrest from the GPS monitoring. Matter to be set the same date as Mr. Nunn  Status conference scheduled for April 2, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian P Dimmer in court.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson

Defendant George Edward Malone in court with attorney Brian P Dimmer.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
Defense asks that the GPS/house arrest condition of bond be removed in 17CF169. The State objects to the modification of bond - argument put on the record by both parties.

BTC: Bond modification as requested in 17CF169 is denied. The Court indicates that bond allows the defendant to go different places as long as it is work related or related to deft's daughter.  Status conference scheduled for December 18, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
